content.raw: I think there's a silent variant of this error, but I'm only guessing. When I kill my python code with ctrl-c, it looks like it's leaking subscribers/publishers and after starting/killing it 5-6 times, it will not get a connection and it will be "waiting for a subscriber" forever. If I create a shutdown hook and unregister() everyting before exiting, I will get the too many open files error after the same 5-6 tries and the sim will be unresponsive just like in the first case. Of course I might be misunderstanding something, but this might be important if a team has to request a reset because the sim is not responding.
